content: The iconic painting 'Starry Night' was created by which post-impressionist artist while he was staying in an asylum in France?

That would be Vincent van Gogh. He painted 'Starry Night' in 1889 while he was residing at the Saint-Paul-de-Mausole asylum in Saint-Rémy-de-Provence, France. It's one of his most renowned works and is known for its swirling skies and emotional intensity.
